issue.title: Question: Does electron-builder use electron mas build when packaging for mas & mas-dev?

repository.name: electron-builder
repository.description: A complete solution to package and build a ready for distribution Electron app with “auto update” support out of the box

issue.body:
<!-- Which version of electron-builder are you using? -->
<!-- Please always try to use latest version before report. -->
* **Version**: 20.28.4

<!-- Which version of electron-updater are you using (if applicable)? -->
Not used

<!-- What target are you building for? -->
* **Target**: mas-dev

<!-- Enter your issue details below this comment. -->
I am trying to use securityScopedBookmarks as described [here](https://electronjs.org/docs/api/dialog#dialogshowopendialogbrowserwindow-options-callback) and [here](https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/11711#issue-164728914).  

When I do my showOpenDialog callback, I'm getting an empty bookmarks return value, which the documentation says: `The bookmarks array will be empty if the app is not bundled for mas`

I *am* bundling for mas. The documentation also says: `Note that in order to test this, one must build electron for mas`

SO - Is electron-builder bundling for mas with the electron-mas build? (eg: electron-v3.0.4-mas-x64.zip)? 

If not, that would explain my problems. If so, then something else is weird.

Thanks.
<!-- If you want, you can donate to increase issue priority (https://www.electron.build/donate) -->

body:
@jfuechsl I'm happy to test that out to see if that works. It still steems strange to me - I seem to be getting behavior that shouldn't happen. Personally I'd put some logging code in to confirm that the parameters I set (settings.security_scoped_bookmarks) are in fact the same as what the function is getting. If not, then something else is amiss. 

But as  I said this is beyond my ability to debug so if someone wants to do a build I'd be happy to test it on my setup.

@rr326 I'm currently trying create a mas build of electron with the effect of the flag neutralized. Just to check if this flag is the culprit, or it it happens further down the stack.
Do you know how to do logging in that part of the codebase?
I'm sorry - I really don't. I would imagine there is a way to push something to the Console.app which, if you don't know, is where MacOS gets its log messages. But just how is beyond me.

I just finished the electron build and tested my app. I now get bookmarks back, so the flag is definitely not passed correctly to OpenDialogCompletion in file_dialog_mac.mm.
Next step is to figure out where the flag-passing goes wrong.

Ok, I think I found the cause of the problem and fixed it. Right now it's a branch in my fork and I will now try to submit a PR. You can find it here https://github.com/jfuechsl/electron/commit/6a55a2b57dba36f4770262e67ab24901268a50d9.

What happens is: ShowOpenDialog is invoked with a `settings` object which holds the `security_scoped_bookmarks` flag. This object is then passed to the completion handler of the dialog where the flag is eventually accessed inside of `OpenDialogCompletion`. Since `settings` is passed as reference, the content of the object could (and in our case does) change before the completion handler is executed - this _somehow_ flips the `security_scoped_bookmarks` flag back to `false`.

My fix is to capture the flag in the calling environment (`ShowOpenDialog` and `ShowSaveDialog`) and then only pass the flag as value to the completion handler (we only access the flag there anyway).

It now works as documented in my examples. I hope to be able to submit the PR very soon and get it merged if it looks ok to others.

issue.title: fix: access of out-of-scope reference in ShowOpenDialog

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
and also in  and ShowSaveDialog.

#### Description of Change
In the mac file dialog implementation of show*OpenDialog, a settings
object is passed down to the dialog completion handler.
However at the time the completion handler is invoked, the settings
object is already out-of-scope, resulting in an invalid access to
the security_scoped_bookmarks flag.
The fix is to capture the value of the flag and passing that directly
to the completion handler.

Closes #16664

#### Checklist
<!-- Remove items that do not apply. For completed items, change [ ] to [x]. -->

- [x] PR description included and stakeholders cc'd
- [x] `npm test` passes (I get timeouts and seemingly unrelated failures)
- [x] PR title follows semantic [commit guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/development/pull-requests.md#commit-message-guidelines)
- [x] [PR release notes](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/master/README.md) describe the change in a way relevant to app developers, and are [capitalized, punctuated, and past tense](https://github.com/electron/clerk/blob/master/README.md#examples).


#### Release Notes

Notes: Fixed a bug when retrieving security scoped bookmarks in `ShowOpenDialog` and `ShowSaveDialog`

body:
I will get to work testing this.

@jfuechsl  - Question - do you think while you are working on this code it would be worth changing the return  value? It seems to me in a non-MAS case, it would be best to return a `null`.   That way in non-MAS, you get `null` and in MAS you either get a `['VALIDBOOKMARKSTRING']` or `['']` (error). 

Or maybe that should be a separate PR?

Also, I'd be happy to document the return values of this feature since they don't exist except in the original PR, if you'd like.
@jfuechsl Do you have a MAS build? I haven't been able to get electron to build so I can't build from source. (Sorry if it's there somewhere - I can't find it.)

@jfuechsl [dialog.md](https://github.com/rr326/electron/blob/ea3033a4cb7737242ca491856dc817ba882a1aa9/docs/api/dialog.md) updated. Sorry - I couldn't figure out how to submit a PR to your repo. I'm new to this. 

Just let me know how else I can help.
